The Lamblite Manual

Dario Teixeira

August 2009

Introduction

Lamblite is a lightweight markup language inspired by Markdown[1] and Creole[2].

1. Paragraphs

You may also use HTML entities such as € or ☃.

Line breaks within one paragraph are not important,since paragraphs are only terminated by an empty line. Within a paragraph you can format certain passagesin **bold text**, //emphasised text//, or even in{{monospaced text}}.

Line breaks within one paragraph are not important, since paragraphs are only terminated by an empty line.

Within a paragraph you can format certain passages in bold text, emphasised text, or even in monospaced text.

2. Lists

The reasons are three: - one- two- three: # a # b # c- four

3. Quotations

This is what you said: > Eggs should be opened by their large end.> Opening them by their small end is heresy. I beg to differ. Let me expand on why.

This is what you said:

Eggs should be opened by their large end. Opening them by their small end is heresy.

I beg to differ. Let me expand on why.

4. Verbatim environments

This is a normal text paragraph: <<----------| |---------->>

5. Code blocks

This is a normal text paragraph: {{let x = a}}
